org.fluidity.testing

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fluidity.testing.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends Object
    Facilitates the use of multiple EasyMock control objects. There are two ways to use this class: as a super class (preferred mode), or as a delegate if inheritance is not an option.

    When used as a super class but with a test harness other than TestNG, or when used as a delegate, the test class must call the clear() method after every test method. When used as a super class of a TestNG based test class, that method will be automatically invoked after every test method.

    Mock objects are produced by instances of the Simulator.MockObjects interface. There are three types of mock objects:

    • normal mock objects that accept only expected methods,
    • lenient mock objects that accept any method, expected or not, and returns default values from unexpected ones,
    • ordered mock objects that accept only expected methods in the expected order
    Mock objects can be used in two distinct contexts:
    • as dependencies of the object under test, created by the Simulator.MockObjects factory returned by dependencies(), or
    • as temporary method local objects as, e.g., method arguments of the object under test, created by the Simulator.MockObjects factory returned by arguments().

    The factory returned by the dependencies() method creates mock objects that will be valid in any test method and should be invoked to initialize instance fields of the test and passed to the object under test, while the factory returned by the arguments() method creates mock objects that will be valid only in the calling method and thus can only be used in that method.

    Usage

    As a super class

     public class MyComponentTest extends Simulator {

   private final Dependency dependency = dependencies().normal(Dependency.class);
   private final MyComponent component = new MyComponent(dependency);

   @Test
   public void testSomething() throws Exception {
     final Action action = arguments().normal(Action.class);

     EasyMock.expect(dependency.getSomeAction()).andReturn(action);
     EasyMock.expect(action.perform()).andReturn(true);

     final boolean success = verify(new Work<Boolean>() {
       public Boolean run() throws Exception {
         return component.doSomething();
       }
     });

     assert success : "No success";
   }
 }

    As a delegate

     public class MyComponentTest {

   private final Simulator simulator = new Simulator();
   private final Dependency dependency = simulator.dependencies().normal(Dependency.class);
   private final MyComponent component = new MyComponent(dependency);

   @AfterMethod
   public void tearDown() throws Exception {
     simulator.clear();
   }

   @Test
   public void testSomething() throws Exception {
     final Action action = simulator.arguments().normal(Action.class);

     EasyMock.expect(dependency.getSomeAction()).andReturn(action);
     EasyMock.expect(action.perform()).andReturn(true);

     final boolean success = group.verify(new Simulator.Work<Boolean>() {
       public Boolean run() throws Exception {
         return component.doSomething();
       }
     });

     assert success : "No success";
   }
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Simulator.Composite<T>
      Composite mock object.
      static interface  Simulator.MockObjects
      Creates mock objects.
      static interface  Simulator.Task
      Encapsulates a sequence of code to execute as part of some test case.
      static interface  Simulator.Threads
      Allows test cases to manage interacting threads.
      static interface  Simulator.Work<T>
      Encapsulates a sequence of code, to execute as part of some test case, that returns some value.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator()
      Default constructor; does nothing.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Simulator.MockObjects arguments()
      Returns a Simulator.MockObjects factory to create method local mock objects to be used, e.g., as method arguments.
      void clear()
      Called after each test method to clear method and thread local mock objects.
      <T> Simulator.Composite<T> composite(Class<T> type, T mock)
      Creates a composite mock object using the given mock object for the main thread, which must be the current thread.
      Simulator.MockObjects concurrent()
      Returns a new Simulator.MockObjects factory to create mock objects with for concurrent access.
      Simulator.MockObjects dependencies()
      Returns a Simulator.MockObjects factory to create mock objects to be used as constructor/field dependencies of the object under test.
      void guarantee(Simulator.Task block)
      Invokes replay(), executes the block, and then, regardless of whether the block throws an exception or not, invokes verify().
      <T> T guarantee(Simulator.Work<T> block)
      Invokes replay(), executes the block, and then, regardless of whether the block throws an exception or not, invokes verify(), and, unless the block threw an exception, returns whatever the block returns.
      Simulator.Threads newThreads(String name)
      Creates a new Simulator.Threads object.

      Executes the given block and returns whatever it returns.

      Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the given expected values are equal to the method parameters at the matched invocation.
      <T> T[] varNotNull(T... expected)
      Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the method parameter list at the matched invocation consists of expected.length number of non-null values.
      <T> T[] varSame(T... expected)
      Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the given expected values are the same as the method parameters at the matched invocation.
      void verify(Simulator.Task block)
      Invokes replay(), executes the block, and then, unless the block throws an exception, invokes verify().

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator()
        Default constructor; does nothing.

    • Method Detail

      • dependencies

        public final Simulator.MockObjects dependencies()
        Returns a Simulator.MockObjects factory to create mock objects to be used as constructor/field dependencies of the object under test. Mock objects created by the returned factory will be reset after each method.
        Returns:
        a Simulator.MockObjects object.

      • arguments

        public final Simulator.MockObjects arguments()
        Returns a Simulator.MockObjects factory to create method local mock objects to be used, e.g., as method arguments. Method local mock objects will be discarded after the test method in which they were created completes.
        Returns:
        a Simulator.MockObjects object.

      • concurrent

        public final Simulator.MockObjects concurrent()
        Returns a new Simulator.MockObjects factory to create mock objects with for concurrent access. Independent mock objects will be discarded after the test method in which they were created completes.
        Returns:
        a Simulator.MockObjects object.

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Called after each test method to clear method and thread local mock objects.

      • test

        public final <T> T test(Simulator.Work<T> block)
                 throws Exception
        Executes the given block and returns whatever it returns. Useful for segmenting steps in a sequence of tests.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the block's return value.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute.
        Returns:
        whatever the block returns.
        Throws:
        Exception - when some error occurs.

      • test

        public final void test(Simulator.Task block)
                throws Exception
        Executes the given block and returns whatever it returns. Useful for segmenting steps in a sequence of tests.
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute.
        Throws:
        Exception - when some error occurs.

      • verify

        public final void verify(Simulator.Task block)
                  throws Exception
        Invokes replay(), executes the block, and then, unless the block throws an exception, invokes verify().
        Parameters:
        block - the block to execute.
        Throws:
        Exception - when some error occurs.

      • varEq

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> T[] varEq(T... expected)
        Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the given expected values are equal to the method parameters at the matched invocation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the expected array.
        Parameters:
        expected - the array of expected values.
        Returns:
        the method parameter.

      • varSame

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> T[] varSame(T... expected)
        Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the given expected values are the same as the method parameters at the matched invocation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the expected array.
        Parameters:
        expected - the array of expected values.
        Returns:
        the method parameter.

      • varNotNull

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> T[] varNotNull(T... expected)
        Argument matcher that understands variadic arguments and asserts that the method parameter list at the matched invocation consists of expected.length number of non-null values.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the component type of the expected array.
        Parameters:
        expected - an array of null values, of the expected size.
        Returns:
        the method parameter.

      • newThreads

        public final Simulator.Threads newThreads(String name)
        Creates a new Simulator.Threads object. The returned object can be used to create concurrent test cases.
        Parameters:
        name - the text to use in thread names to distinguish threads created by the returned Simulator.Threads instance from other instances.
        Returns:
        a new Simulator.Threads instance; never null.

      • composite

        public final <T> Simulator.Composite<T> composite(Class<T> type,
                                                  T mock)
        Creates a composite mock object using the given mock object for the main thread, which must be the current thread. The composite mock object can then be used to create thread local mock objects for the same dependency using the Simulator.Composite.normal(), Simulator.Composite.lenient(), and Simulator.Composite.ordered() methods.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the mocked dependency.
        Parameters:
        type - the dependency class to mock.
        mock - the mock object created for the main thread.
        Returns:
        a composite mock object suitable for multi-threaded access.
